title: Strange platform specific overfow in trait resulution
body:
I've seeing a strange type overflow on diesels ci. (See the windows_sqlite stable build [here](https://dev.azure.com/diesel-rs/diesel/_build/results?buildId=9&view=logs) for example.)
The strange thing is that this only happens on windows, all other (tested) platforms are working fine. Diesel [does not](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/search?l=Rust&q=%23%5Bcfg%28windows%29%5D) contain any relevant conditional compilation that does depended on the target platform.

I would expect such an error happening either on none or on all platforms.

Unfortunately I've no access to a windows machine to reproduce/verify this any further.

Steps to reproduce this:
* checkout [diesel master](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/commit/5629f6dae55e615b79ba54a3ebc01902b96240e8) on a windows machine
* change to the diesel_test crate
* install sqlite and make it available in the linker path (or add `libsqlite3-sys = { version = ">=0.8.0, <0.11.0", features = ["bundled"] }` to the `Cargo.toml` of diesel_test to build sqlite while building diesel.)
* Build diesels sqlite tests by running `cargo test --features "sqlite" 

Environment:
* CI system, [Azure pipelines](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/commit/5629f6dae55e615b79ba54a3ebc01902b96240e8) and [Appveyor](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/sgrif/diesel/build/job/igu8d6k7revlhvu9)
* Platform: Windows
* Toolchain: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
* Channel: last stable, beta and nightly (multiple versions, see CI for exact versions)


cc @sgrif @killercup @Eijebong
